8 Jan 2021 • on Data Science, Data Analytics

What's on an aspiring data scientist's bookmarks

Here are my favorite free online studying materials and career prep tools for newbies building a data science career in 2021(including myself).

Statistics

  • Think Stats 2e - Book
  • Think Bayes - Book
  • Introduction to Biostatistics offered by The Johns Hopkins University - Lectures

Python + Machine Learning

  • Think Python 2e - Book
  • Python Data Science Handbook - Book
  • TensorFlow, Keras and deep learning, without a PhD - Book

In youtube, there are countless channels dedicated to the topic. My frequently visited sites are:

  • 3Blue1Brown - Cool visualization helps. Neural network series is my favorite.
  • freeCodeCamp
  • Data Umbrella
  • PyData’s local community meetups

Open data sources

  • Kaggle
  • DRIVENDATA - Kaggle-like website providing data for social good
  • TidyTuesday - Open datasets provided by R community
  • The Humanitarian Data Exchange - Humanitarian database provided by OCHA

Career advice

  • Build a Career in Data Science Podcast - Podcast
  • Data science is different now - Blog post
  • Advancing Your Data Science Career During the Pandemic - Video
  • @BecomingDataSci on twitter and her collection of DS learning materials
  • Data Helpers - A list of data professionals who are willing to help newcomers

CV / Résumé

  • Overleaf - Great for CV and cover letter; Easy of use & free templates available
  • GitHub Pages - To build a personalized website for portfolio
